item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, April 12, 2025 at 8:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. $70M in 60 Seconds: How Insider Info Helped Someone 28x Their Money (371 points | 149 comments)
2. Google Is Winning on Every AI Front (153 points | 91 comments)
3. Rust to C compiler – 95.9% test pass rate, odd platforms (98 points | 27 comments)
4. You might not need WebSockets (245 points | 158 comments)
5. Vacheron Constantin breaks the world record for most complicated wristwatch (182 points | 144 comments)
6. Fedora change aims for 99% package reproducibility (345 points | 167 comments)
7. Intentionally Making Close Friends (2021) (195 points | 29 comments)
8. A 32-bit processor made with an atomically thin semiconductor (179 points | 34 comments)
9. Adobe deletes Bluesky posts after backlash (337 points | 404 comments)
10. Why 'Prince Rupert's Drop' Glass Is Strong Enough to Shatter a Bullet (9 points | 1 comment)
11. Erlang's not about lightweight processes and message passing (2023) (243 points | 137 comments)
12. Every picture from Venus' surface, ever (2021) (28 points | 5 comments)
13. Once lush Sahara was home to a surprisingly unique group of humans (98 points | 15 comments)
14. Germany creates 'super–high-tech ministry' for research, technology, aerospace (198 points | 206 comments)
15. Blue Prince is a roguelike puzzle masterpiece (133 points | 81 comments)
16. Show HN: Omiword – A daily, sector-based word puzzle (43 points | 28 comments)
17. Datastar: Web Framework for the Future? (208 points | 112 comments)
18. Lead is still bad for your brain (165 points | 138 comments)
19. Bonobos use a kind of syntax once thought to be unique to humans (154 points | 103 comments)
20. Windows 2000 Server named peak Microsoft (151 points | 198 comments)
21. AI Coding and the Peanut Butter and Jelly Problem (82 points | 46 comments)
22. Google will let companies run Gemini models in their own data centers (5 points | 1 comment)
23. WebRTC for the Curious (135 points | 29 comments)
24. But what if I want a faster horse? (1279 points | 546 comments)
25. Leaked data reveals Israeli govt campaign to remove pro-Palestine posts on Meta (855 points | 541 comments)
26. Bilinear interpolation on a quadrilateral using Barycentric coordinates (115 points | 28 comments)
27. Soil from the moon's far side suggests drier conditions than side facing Earth (14 points | 1 comment)
28. Pinball Brothers – A Swedish-Italian Pinball Company (26 points | 5 comments)
29. A recent study suggests that insects branched out from crustaceans (89 points | 84 comments)
30. Grappling with Infinity in Constraint Solvers (21 points | discuss)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, April 12, 2025 at 8:20 AM UTC
